results.title: Festivals in Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Yu Ping Chung, David J.C. Shih, Weng Jeng-Yih and Goang Jiann Enterprises Corporation
results.brief_description: Chinese traditions, customs and festivals centre around the lunar calendar. In Taiwan, these customs and festivals take the form of a unique culture of temple fairs, each with their own local emphasis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yu Ping Chung, David J.C. Shih, Weng Jeng-Yih and Goang Jiann Enterprises Corporation

results.title: Festival time
results.creator_credit: V.R. Sarma, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: V.R. Sarma, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.

results.title: Festival of the pig
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Shows the villagers of New Guinea preparing for a feast in which pig is the chief item of food. Their elaborate costumes and a tribal dance are shown, while the sound track includes actual chants.
results.description: Shows the villagers of New Guinea preparing for a feast in which pig is the chief item of food. Their elaborate costumes and a tribal dance are shown, while the sound track includes actual chants.

results.title: Festival of kites
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the City of Darebin, this short video documents the Festival of Kites, organized by the North Eastern Melbourne Chinese Association and by the Australian Kite Association. An all-day event held in parklands in Preston, this multicultural event includes performances by comedians, Indian dancers and a Chinese Choir.

results.title: Festival of family classics. -Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Features 2 family classics; “Around the world in 80 days” Part 1 & 2; Phineas Fogg, accompanied by his loyal valet, Passpartout, embark on a wager to circle the world in 80 days. Their ability to meet the deadline is threatened by Detective Fix who mistakes Fogg for a bank robber. “Puss in boots”; Orlando the cat learns to talk thanks to a pair of magic boots. Will he use his new power for good? Introduced by Chelsea Brown.

results.title: Festival of family classics.- Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Introduced by Chelsea Brown this tape includes 3 stories. “Cinderella”; the classic story with the inclusion of a bumbling knight and an absentminded godmother makes this story an hilariously funny one; “A Christmas tree”; based on the Charles Dickens story this tale is about Peter and Mary, two children out to recover the spirit of Christmas; “Robin Hood”; Robin Hood is captured by the mean sheriff of Nottingham.

results.title: Festival in Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: Douglas Clarke, Howard Thomas and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1954 Edinburgh Festival of music and drama, including a short sequence showing Margot Fonteyn and Michael Somes dancing ‘The Firebird’, Ann Todd and Paul Rogers in a scene from Macbeth, Sir Adrian Boult conducting the National Youth Orchestra and before the castle.

results.title: Festival in Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Richard Mason, Loch Townsend, Malcolm Otton, Maslyn Williams, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows something of the preparation that went into the Adelaide Festival of Arts 1962, and excerpts from the performances themselves. General notes: AFI Award: silver award (documentary) 1963.
